Comments
the campus is very safe. there are call boxes all over campus. the security will escort you back to your dorm if you are out late. the security personnel is very helpful and friendly.
there are numerous greek organizations on campus. the greeks have houses located on or very near the campus.
the university has over 800 clubs and if you don't find something to interest you. you are encouraged to start your own club.

the university has something for all types of students. the university encourages students to explore things that they would not normally consider. the university helps to expand your career intrests.
the tuition is reasonable. you pay for the first 13 hours any additional hours are included. there is a variety of meal plans that are affordable. some of the dorms do not require meal plans.

the is a bowling& billards area in the mu. the dorms and the various clubs always have a variety of activities. sports are also a way to have fun at the games. a new atheltic facility will be open that will provide a swimming area and exercise rooms.
there is always a variety of different types of food that meets the dietary requirements for everyone.
there are a variety of dorms and they are all very good. living with a new roommate is different and fun.
the classes are challenging. develop a study schedule and stick to it.
be open to new experiences and get to know your professors. take advantage of office hours even if you do not require help.
iowa state's teachers are very supportive and helpful. the classes cover a large variety of subjects. there are 800 clubs to become involved in.

textAfterTable: Am enjoying being here Ames, IA has one of the lowest crime rates in the U.S., and is generally relaxed. Football and basketball games are an absolute blast, and the town does get a little crazy. The school has a very friendly atmosphere, and it's easy to meet new people. There are all kinds of big events that happen, like E-Week or VEISHEA (if you don't know about VEISHEA yet, Google it), but there are also plenty of small ones. Whether you collect famous toothbrushes or like smashing computers to bits, you can find a student organization to share your passion with others. In short, it's hard not to enjoy Iowa State. Am learning a lot You learn a lot in college, but at Iowa State you can learn anything you could imagine. The professors are true experts in their fields, and do an excellent job teaching. The living experience at ISU leads to a lot of great insights too, especially if you're living in Friley or Helser Halls. Login to rate or flag the reviews Meghan from Walnut, IL 06/09/2009 Reviewer is A current student here. 14 out of
